Framework classes

Private

class access_manager.Access_manager

Bases: object

Class that handle user management. It provide easy method to get the current user and its auhtorization on a given page or module.

Warning

It is supposed that there is a correctly configured “config.json” pertinent to the application

authorize_group(allowed_groups: Optional[list] = None) → bool

Indicate if the current user is in an authorized group

Parameters

allowed_groups (list, optional) – A list of groups, defaults to None

Returns

True if the current user is in the list, or if login is disabled, false otherwise

Return type

bool

authorize_module(module: str) → bool

Indicate if the current user has access to the given module

Parameters

module (str) – The module to check

Returns

True if the current user is authorized to access the group

Return type

bool

get_login() → bool

Return the information as to if a user is logged

Returns

True if a user is logged

Return type

bool

get_user() → str

Return the currently logged user, if any

Returns

The currently logged user

Return type

str

load_authorizations()

Load the authorization file into the manager

set_user(user: str, password: str)

Set the current user

Parameters

  • user (str) – The user to set

  • password (str) – The password of the user

use_login(login: bool)

Activate the login capabilities of the website

Parameters

login (bool) – True to activate the login capabilities, False otherwise

Public base

class site_conf.Site_conf

Bases: object

Provides a set of function to configure the website

add_javascript(script: str)

Add a new script to load on the page

Parameters

script (str) – A string with the path to the string, from assets/js

add_sidebar_page(name: str, icon: str, url: str)

Add a page to the sidebar

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the page

  • icon (str) – The page icon, from the mdi icon pack.

  • url (str) – The url of the page

add_sidebar_section(section: str, icon: str, endpoint: str)

Add a section to the sidebar. Sections are not clickable and are meant to host a submenu

Parameters

  • section (str) – The section

  • icon (str) – The section icon, from the mdi icon pack.

  • endpoint (str) – The endpoint address of the section.

add_sidebar_submenu(name: str, url: str, parameter: Optional[str] = None, endpoint: Optional[str] = None)

Add a submenu to the sidebar. It uses the url in order to extract the section. The url must be in the form endpoint.page

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the submenu

  • url (str) – The url of the submenu

  • parameter (str, optional) – Optional parameters for the page, that is the part of the GET url (e.g: topic=help), defaults to None

  • endpoint (str, optional) – Optional endpoint override, instead of using the one in the url., defaults to None

add_sidebar_title(title: str)

Add a sidebar title, which can logically seperate several parts of the sidebar

Parameters

title (str) – The title to add

add_topbar_button(id: str, icon: str, text: str, area: str, link: Optional[str] = None)

Add a new button to the topbar

Parameters

  • id (str) – The id (of the div) of the button

  • icon (str) – The icon, from the mdi library

  • text (str) – The text of the button

  • area (str) – The area of the topbar where the button lives (left, center or right)

  • link (str, optional) – Optional link where the button will point, defaults to None

add_topbar_modal(id: str, icon: str, text: str, area: str, modal_text: str, modal_title: str, modal_footer: str, color: str)

Add a new button to the topbar that will display a modal information.

Modal text content can be modified later on with the scheduler, or with the update_topbar_modal function

Parameters

  • id (str) – The id (of the div) of the button

  • icon (str) – The icon, from the mdi library

  • text (str) – The text of the button

  • area (str) – The area of the topbar where the button lives (left, center or right)

  • modal_text (str) – The content of the modal

  • modal_title (str) – _description_

  • modal_footer (str) – The title of the modal

  • color (str) – The footer of the modal

add_topbar_thread_info(icon: str, area: str)

Add a zone where the thread are displayed. It can be skinned with an icon

Parameters

  • icon (str) – The skin icon, mdi format

  • area (str) – The zone (center, left, right) where the status lives in the topbar

app_details(name: str, version: str, icon: str)

Set the application details

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the application

  • version (str) – The version of the application

  • icon (str) – The icon of the application, in mdi format

context_processor()

Function that is called before rendering any page, should be overwritten by the child object

create_distribuate()

Function to create the distribuable package on this plateform, should be overwritten by the child object

m_app = {'icon': 'home', 'name': 'Default', 'version': '0'}

App information

m_javascripts = []

Custom javascripts

m_sidebar = []

Sidebar content

m_topbar = {'center': [], 'display': False, 'left': [], 'login': False, 'right': []}

Topbar content

p_updates_ftp = False

Variable to indicate that this site support ftp updates

socketio_event(event)

Function called to respond to event, should be overwritten by the child object

update_topbar_button(id: str, icon: str, text: str, area: str, color: str = 'secondary', link: Optional[str] = None)

Update a new button to the topbar, works also for modals

Parameters

  • id (str) – The id (of the div) of the button

  • icon (str) – The icon, from the mdi library

  • text (str) – The text of the button

  • area (str) – The area of the topbar where the button lives (left, center or right)

  • color (str, optional) – The color of the button, defaults to “secondary”

  • link (str, optional) – Optionnal link, href on the button, defaults to None

update_topbar_modal(id: str, text: str, area: str)

Update the content text of a modal

Parameters

  • id (str) – The id (of the div) of the button

  • text (str) – The text of the button

  • area (str) – The area of the topbar where the button lives (left, center or right)

use_login()

Indicate that this website uses login

class threaded_manager.Threaded_manager

Bases: object

Manage the different threads of the framework

Add a new thread to the pool

Parameters

thread (threading.Thread) – The thread to add

del_thread(thread: Thread)

Delete a thread from the pool

Parameters

thread (_type_) – The thread to delete

get_names() → list

Return the list of all the threads, by name

Returns

A list of thread’s names

Return type

list

get_thread(name: str) → Thread

Return a thread by it’s name

Parameters

name (str) – The name of the desired thread

Returns

The thread object, or None if the name is not found

Return type

threading.Thread

m_running_threads = []

List of the currently running threads

class threaded_action.Threaded_action

Bases: object

Base class to execute long term action. It registeres itself on the thread manager and handle the creation and destruction of the python thread.

Moreover, it provides a set of helper function to communication with the host (Windows, Linux or Macos) in order to call, for instance, scripts or programs.

action()

Main function of this thread

change_name(name: str)

Change the name of the instance of the module

Parameters

name (str) – The new name

delete()

Delete the thread and unregister it from the thread manager

get_name() → str

Return the name of the instance

Returns

The name of the instance

Return type

str

m_default_name = 'Default name'

The name of the module

m_name

Constructor

m_scheduler = None

Link to the sceduler object

m_type = 'threaded_action'

The type of the module

process_close()

Kill and close the local process

process_delete_results()

Delete the results of the process

process_exec(command: list, source_folder: str, shell=True, inputs=None)

Execute a local process command. This function is not blocking, and will return immediately, even if the command is not over. Use command_wait() to detect the end of the command.

Parameters

  • command (list) – The command to execute

  • source_folder (str) – The relative path of execution

  • shell (bool, optional) – The shell argument of subprocess, defaults to True

  • inputs (_type_, optional) – a list with detection of a specific string and how to react, defaults to None

process_format_results() → list

Format the results of the process, and reset them. By default, the formating does nothing and just send the raw data.

Returns:

list: The result of the last executed (or executing) process

process_read_results()

Read the raw results of the last executed (executing) process, and delete them

process_read_stderr()

Read thread for the error output of the currently executing local process

process_read_stdout()

Read thread for the standard output of the currently executing local process

process_wait()

Wait for the currently executing local process to finish

start()

Thread start

thread_process()

Thread function

wait_finished()

Thread finish

class action.Action

Bases: object

Base class to execute immediate action. This module is a simplified version of the thraded_action, which provides the minimum in order to successfully integrate with web display engine

get_name() → str

Return the name of the instance

Returns

The name of the instance

Return type

str

m_default_name = 'Default'

Name of the action

m_type = 'Action'

The type of the module

start()

Main function

class scheduler.Scheduler

Bases: object

Basic scheduler class, which has the responsability to handle periodic tasks. This is the base class, which generate the messages to the website and handle the special buttons, if any.

disable_button(id: str)

Disable a button by its id

Parameters

id (str) – The id of the button

emit_button(id: str, icon: str, text: str, style: str = 'primary')

Change the content of a topbar button

Parameters

  • id (str) – The id of the button to

  • icon (str) – The icon of the button to change, from the mdi icons

  • text (str) – The new text

  • style (str, optional) – The bootstrap style of the button. Defaults to “primary”., defaults to “primary”

emit_content(category: str, content: dict)

Emit the content that can be dinamicaly showed in the page without user reload

Parameters

  • category (str) – The category of the content

  • content (dict) – The content itself

emit_modal(id: str, content: str)

Change the content of a topbar modal

Parameters

  • id (str) – The id of the button to

  • content (str) – The new text

emit_popup(level: logLevel, string: str)

“Emit a a popup that will be displayed to the user

Parameters

  • level (logLevel) – The log level of the popup (succes, info, warning or error)

  • string (str) – The content of the popup. Some html can be present in it.

emit_reload(content: str)

Send some information about a formulaire that needs to be refreshed on the page

Parameters

content (str) – The content of the formulaire, in the form of a list of {id: “…”, content: “…”}

emit_result(category: str, content)

Add a result information in the bottom of the “Action progress”. The category is any category supported by bootstrap (success, danger, etc…)

Parameters

  • category (str) – A category from bootstrap

  • content (_type_) – The content to display. HTML is supported

emit_status(category: str, string: str, status: int = 0, supplement: str = '')

Queue a message status to be sent to the web client

Parameters

  • category (str) – The category that indicate where the status will be published in the main page

  • string (str) – The information string to display to the user

  • status (int, optional) – The status, a number between 0 and 100% that indicate the progress. At 100% the task is considered as successfull. The status 101% can be used to indicate an error, defaults to 0

  • supplement (str, optional) – A supplement status that can be used to add information on the main case, defaults to “”

enable_button(id: str)

Enable a button by its id

Parameters

id (str) – The id of the button

m_button_disable = []

List of the buttons that will be disabled

m_button_enable = []

List of the buttons that will be enabled

m_buttons = []

List of the buttons information (for instance, in topbar) that has not been sent to the website yet

m_contents = []

To remove

m_modals = []

List of the modals dialogs that has not been sent to the website yet

m_popups = []

List of the popups that has not been sent to the website yet

m_reload = []

List of the reload information. A reload information concerns any item on the website that can be dinamicaly reloaded.

m_results = []

List of the results (from the task actions field in the webengine) that has not been sent to the website yet

m_status = []

List of the status information that has not been sent to the website yet

m_user_connected = False

Indicate if a user is connected. If not, the scheduler is halted

socket_obj = None

Main object to the client socketio instance

start()

Start the scheduler

user_after()

Function to be overwritten by specific website, ut is executed at the end of a scheduler cycle

user_before()

Function to be overwritten by specific website, ut is executed at the begning of a scheduler cycle

Utilities

utilities.util_dir_list(root: str, inclusion: Optional[list] = None, modifier: Optional[str] = None) → list

Scan a directory, without it’s children and return a list of the file that have the inclusion information given by the user

Parameters

  • root (str) – The root folder

  • inclusion (list, optional) – A list of inclusion, that is part of the file name or extension that must be present in the files listed, defaults to None

  • modifier (str, optional) – A function that change the name (parsing for instance), defaults to None

Returns

A list of the corresponding files

Return type

list

utilities.util_dir_structure(root: str, inclusion: Optional[list] = None, modifier=None, clean=True) → dict

Create the directory structure (all the directories and subfiles) recursively from a root folder

Parameters

  • root (str) – The root folder

  • inclusion (list, optional) – A list of inclusion, that is part of the file name or extension that must be present in the files listed, defaults to None

  • modifier (_type_, optional) – A function that change the name (parsing for instance), defaults to None

  • clean (bool, optional) – Clean all empty folder from the results, defaults to True

Returns

A dictionnary with the file structure in the form:

code-block:

{
dir: 
    { dir: {...}, file, file}, file
}
Return type

dict

utilities.util_find_files(root: str, inclusion: Optional[list] = None) → list

Find all the files in a directory structure that fit the inclusion description, and return a list of the files with respect to the root path

Parameters

  • root (str) – The root folder

  • inclusion (list, optional) – A list of inclusion, that is part of the file name or extension that must be present in the files listed, defaults to None

Returns

A list of the found files

Return type

list

utilities.util_list_serial() → list

Return the list of the serial ports on the machine

Raises

EnvironmentError – Unsupported platform

Returns

The serial ports on the machine

Return type

list

utilities.util_post_to_json(data: dict) → dict

Transform an html datastructure into a easy to manipulate json. The html datastructure should be in the following form: { level0a.level1a = a level0a.level1b = b level0b.levelx = x } for the following result: { level0a = { level1a = a level1b = b }; level0b = { levelx = x } }

Parameters

data (dict) – The html post data

Returns

A json representation of the data

Return type

dict

utilities.util_post_unmap(data: dict) → dict

Parse the mapping fields in order to transform them in a more user friendly structure. As a result, a simple map will transform from: {“mapright0”: “val0”, “mapleft0”: “val1”, …} to {“val0”: “val1”}

and a dualmap will transform from: {“mapAright0”: “val0”, “mapAleft0”: “val1”, “mapBright0”: “val2”, “mapBleft0”: “val3”} to [{“val0”: “val1”, “val2”: “val3”}]

Parameters

data (dict) – The json data to parse

Returns

A dictionnary with the mapping correctly transformed

Return type

dict

utilities.util_read_parameters() → dict

Read the parameters of the application

Returns

The parameters of the application

Return type

dict

utilities.util_view_add_array(modules: dict, module: str, id: str, message: str, header: list, data: dict, button: Optional[str] = None, submenu=None, display_only=False)

Add an array to the given view

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • message (str) – The message for the user

  • header (list) – The header of the array

  • data – The available data in the array. The array is represented by a dictionnary in the form:

{
    "col0_name": [{"id": "id to recover the data", "type":"int, text, date, colored or hidden", "value":"pre-set value, facultative"}]
}

:param If no id is provided, then the field will be display only (that is, not a form) :param If type == colored, an additional field named “limits” must be present: [“type”, x, y] where type is “less” or “more” and x, y, the 2 limits for the badge display :type data: dict :param button: A button for the form, defaults to None :type button: str, optional :param submenu: The submenu of the form, defaults to None :type submenu: _type_, optional :param display_only: If set to True, the table will take the whole width of the page. Otherwise, the message will be showed on the left of the table, defaults to False :type display_only: bool, optional

utilities.util_view_add_header_button(modules: dict, module: str, id: str, button_type: str, link: str, options=[])

Add an array to the given view

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • button_type (str) – The type of button to add on the header. Can be “add”, “modify”

  • link (str) – The link where the button points to.

  • options (list, optional) – A list of options that will be used to generate the link

utilities.util_view_add_header_pages(modules: dict, module: str, id: str, link: str, pages: int = 1, options=[])

Add a page link option on the header

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • pages (int) – The number of pages to display

  • link (str) – The link where the button points to.

  • options (list, optional) – A list of options that will be used to generate the link

utilities.util_view_add_info_download(modules: dict, module: str, id: str, message: str, file: str, submenu=None)

Add a number input an a view module that can be passed in the base_content template

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • message (str) – The message for the user

  • file (str) – The name of the file to download

  • submenu (_type_, optional) – A subemenu for the form, defaults to None

utilities.util_view_add_info_graph(modules: dict, module: str, message: str, x_axis: list, y_axises: list, submenu: Optional[str] = None, data_type='date')

Add a graphic

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • message (str) – A message that fit with the graph

  • x_axis (list) – A x axis serie

  • y_axises (list) – A list of y axis serie

  • submenu (str, optional) – A submenu for the form, defaults to None

  • data_type (str, optional) – The datatype, see the js library, defaults to “date”

utilities.util_view_add_info_text(modules: dict, module: str, text: str, submenu=None, id=None)

Add a simple text

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • text (str) – A message that fit with the graph

  • submenu (_type_, optional) – A submenu for the form, defaults to None

  • id (_type_, optional) – The id of the text, defaults to None

utilities.util_view_add_input_file(modules: dict, module: str, id: str, message: str, button: Optional[str] = None, submenu=None)

Add a file input an a view module that can be passed in the base_content template

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • message (str) – The message for the user

  • button (str, optional) – A button for the form, defaults to None

  • submenu (_type_, optional) – A submenu for the fomr, defaults to None

utilities.util_view_add_input_file_manager(modules: dict, module: str, id: str, message: str, button: Optional[str] = None, files: list = [], title: list = [], icons: list = [], classes: list = [], hiddens: list = [], submenu=None)

Add a file manager to delete files from the target and add the to it. It is possible to add several file managers by using lists for arguments files, titles and icons

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • message (str) – The message for the user

  • button (str, optional) – A button for the forms, defaults to None

  • files (list, optional) – A list of file already present, defaults to []

  • title (list, optional) – A list of the titles of the file explorers, defaults to []

  • icons (list, optional) – A list of the icons (the mdi project names) of the file explorers, defaults to []

  • classes (list, optional) – A list of the classes (the bootsrap classes such as danger, success or primary) used in the file explorers, defaults to []

  • hiddens (list, optional) – A list of true / false to indicate if a file explorer has a button to collapse the content, defaults to []

  • submenu (_type_, optional) – A submenu for the form, defaults to None

utilities.util_view_add_input_hidden(modules: dict, module: str, id: str, message: str, button: Optional[str] = None, submenu=None)

Add a simple hidden field

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • message (str) – The content of the field

  • button (str, optional) – A button for the fomr, defaults to None

  • submenu (_type_, optional) – A submenu for the form, defaults to None

utilities.util_view_add_multi_input(modules: dict, module: str, id: str, inputs: dict, button: Optional[str] = None, submenu: Optional[str] = None, button_disabled: bool = False)

Add a multi-input, that is a set of several input types that are under on single button. Supported inputs are - number - text - select - TODO: update

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • inputs (dict) – A list of dictionnary representing the inputs in the form

  • [{id – id, type: “text, number, select”, value: “”, label: “”}]

  • button (str, optional) – A button for the form, defaults to None

  • submenu (str, optional) – A submenu for the form, defaults to None

  • button_disabled (bool, optional) – Set the button in disabled state

utilities.util_view_add_text_highlight(modules: dict, module: str, info: Optional[str] = None, warning: Optional[str] = None, error: Optional[str] = None, success: Optional[str] = None, submenu: Optional[str] = None)

Add a warning or an info (or both) to a view module that can be passed in the base_content template

Parameters

  • modules (dict) – The view module in which the new select will be added

  • module (str) – The module name to which the select choice will be added

  • info (str, optional) – An info text to display. defaults to None

  • warning (str, optional) – A warning text to display, defaults to None

  • error (str, optional) – An error text to display, defaults to None

  • success (str, optional) – A success text to display (green, wide), defaults to None

  • submenu (str, optional) – A submenu for the form, defaults to None

utilities.util_view_reload_input_file_manager(id: str, files: list = [], title: list = [], icons: list = [], classes: list = [], hiddens: list = []) → dict

Create the content necessary to reload a given input file manager

Parameters

  • id (str) – The id of the form

  • files (list, optional) – A list of the files that should be already in the file manager, defaults to []

  • title (list, optional) – A list of the titles of the file explorers, defaults to []

  • icons (list, optional) – A list of the icons (the mdi project names) of the file explorers, defaults to []

  • classes (list, optional) – A list of the classes (the bootsrap classes such as danger, success or primary) used in the file explorers, defaults to []

  • hiddens (list, optional) – A list of true / false to indicate if a file explorer has a button to collapse the content, defaults to []

Returns

The rendered html code to display

dict

class updater.UPDATER_exec

Bases: Threaded_action

Module to handle updated and apply them

Update package can be downlaoded from FTP servers, provided that the correct credentials are given in the settings

  • create (to create a new package)

  • upload (to upload a previously created package to the FTP server)

class updater.UPDATER_maker

Bases: Threaded_action

Module to create and upload the update packages.

Update package can be uploaded to FTP servers, provided that the correct credentials are given in the settings

action()

Execute the module

m_action = None
m_default_name = 'Website engine update creation'

The name of the module

m_package = None
set_action(action: str) → None

Set the action to perform

Parameters

action (str) –

Can be the following values:

  • create (to create a new package)

  • upload (to upload a previously created package to the FTP server)

set_type(type: str) → None

Set the type of package to handle

Parameters

type (str) –

Can be the following values:

  • source (Only the python files)

  • distribution (PyInstaller distribution. Must be supported by the site_conf, see Site_conf.create_distribuate())

updater.update()

Update page to handle update package creation (if credential authorize it) or update package download and application
